content:
@Grahame Grieve in the core spec there are external terminology systems referenced under hl7.org e.g.
http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icpc-2
http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/icf-nl
http://hl7.org/fhir/ndfrt

are the different bases http://hl7.org/fhir/sid/ or http://hl7.org/fhir/ a choice or part of history?
is there a current preferred way? will go that way for AU specs also where needed
sid was something we introduced early, and probably should have copied for ndfrt - there's no poicy reason why they're different

Wondering if other's have sorted issues with IG's that use the NCTS terminologies?
Code System URI 'https://healthterminologies.gov.au/fhir/CodeSystem/ihi-status-1' is unknown so the code cannot be validated
or gtin and pbs codes?
Not me.
@Brett Esler @Danielle Tavares @Shovan Roy @Shovan Roy @Shovan (not sure which Shovan you are :wink: )

no - we just have a naked link; NCTS terminologies land in the right place for viewing; and enhancement is coming for the presentation in the future. No validation is done for NCTS in the IG build; only terminologies in FHIR tx server are used for the build. PBS and GTIN in AU base are referred to as external codesystems only - general GTIN validation is not a thing; this is a product catalouge that changes and don;t think there is a publication of content; PBS could be done as FHIR but not sure where this is at
@Liam Barnes @Jim Steel @Michael Lawley

Can do regular validation as you'd expect by loading all the terminology referenced; profiles and then validating.
Jim and Michael - if we loaded everything into Onto that could be used for 'complete' validation of instances right?
There's really 2 issues here, 1 is for the GTIN/PBS, just to recognise them, but not validate them - bare codesystem I guess, but the NCSTS stuff - enabling validation to know about them.
The representation of PBS in FHIR is being progressed by Dept of Health. I don't have visibility of it and have not been able to get an update on it.

We don't have packages to reference to bring in CodeSystem content from NCTS; in theory we could... would need to work out published versions etc. ; SNOMED validation is based on what is loaded in the IG build tx server so that needs SCT-AU generally for that stuff.

basically a terminology package - could do the trick I think for an IG at a point in time - this has been floated before however NCTS is running more as a live service and IG publisher won't pick up external resources based on reference by URL alone

Brian Postlethwaite said:

Wondering if other's have sorted issues with IG's that use the NCTS terminologies?
Code System URI 'https://healthterminologies.gov.au/fhir/CodeSystem/ihi-status-1' is unknown so the code cannot be validated
or gtin and pbs codes?

we do face the same warnings with default IG-Publisher. OnTo server FHIR validation works after loading the terminology https://healthterminologies.gov.au/fhir/CodeSystem/ihi-status-1

When we rely on SCT-AU the international tx server for IG build does not guarantee up to date international versions so often get QA warnings on that content also. @Jim Steel @Michael Lawley - in theory we could do local IG build referencing a fully populated Onto instance and get a good result - right?
Yes
I still don't entirely follow why the IG config can't be used to point at a different tx server. You'd probably want some kind of whitelisting to protect the build server, but that should be simple
it's on my to do list
I'm assuming it's an update to https://github.com/FHIR/auto-ig-builder ?
Or it should be behaviour associated with IGBuildMode.AUTOBUILD?
it'll be in the java code, associated with autobuild
but it's actually waiting for me to have a chance to work on the codableconcept validation problem
Is there a parameter to pass to the builder (for my own CI process) ?
no. And at present there's no other server than mine that supports the IG builder
